all_response:
Jax: You need to escort the injured people to a castle with medical staff so that they can be treated. You should be careful on your journey and choose an appropriate carriage to carry the injured as you will almost certainly pass a volcano to reach the castle wand this could destroy the carriage and leave the injured to a deadly fate. You will also need use appropriate healing spells regularly to keep the injured alive on the way.
Jax: A clay carriage would be best for insulating against the heat of the volcano. The others would be too risky.
Jax: You should use the common healing technique because the divine healing technique only work on magical creatures such as elves.
Jax: You need to reach the Sacred Castle because only the Sacred Castle has medical staff to treat the injured and save them.

all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain which carriage to use for the journey. This response addresses the question of which carriage to use, specifying that the clay carriage is best for insulating against the heat of the volcano. This response alleviates concerns about the risk of using the wooden or metal carriages, which could be destroyed by the heat. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of choosing the appropriate carriage for the journey.

Jax previously mentioned the need to use healing techniques but did not specify which one to use. This response addresses the question of which healing technique to use, specifying that the common healing technique should be used because the divine healing technique only works on magical creatures such as elves. This response clarifies the appropriate healing method for the injured people. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on which healing technique to use.

There are two castles in the game scenario, and the previous response did not specify which castle to go to for medical treatment. This response addresses the question of which castle to reach, specifying that it should be the Sacred Castle because only the Sacred Castle has medical staff to treat the injured and save them. This response clarifies the destination for the journey. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple castles and is unsure which one to go to for medical treatment.

all_response:
Jax: Your task is to escort the princess to a sanctuary. First, you need to plan a route; to reach any sanctuary, you must pass through the Primeval Jungle. Remember, not all vehicles are suitable for traversing the jungle so choose the right mode of transportation.
Jax: A bulletproof car will be able to withstand attacks from wild beasts in the Primeval Jungle and can travel steadily on rough roads.
Jax: Gasoline can be found at a castle.
Jax: Only the Sacred Castle has gasoline.
Jax: You need to reach the Dali Sanctuary, because it is the only place you will be completely safe.

all_response:
Jax: You need to transport the injured person back to the Seaside Town for treatment as quickly as possible. First, take the patient to the Capital using a carriage, then switch to a faster mode of transportation to get the patient to the seaside town. You will need to travel through the Primeval Forest to get to the Capital. But beware, the forest is full of dangers and you will need to use magic to protect the patient and yourself.
Jax: The wooden carriage is the lightest and fastest, and your best chance of getting to the Capital in time.
Jax: Upon reaching the capital, you should travel by car to the Seaside Town. Travelling by plane or train will take too long and the patient's condition could worsen.
Jax: It is said the forest is filled with poisonous insects so you should be prepared to use the insect resistance magic.

all_response_exaplain: There are three types of carriages in the backpack: a wooden carriage, a metal carriage, and a clay carriage. The previous responses did not specify which carriage to use for transporting the injured person. This response addresses the question of which carriage to use, specifying that the wooden carriage is the lightest and fastest, making it the best option for getting to the Capital in time. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple carriages and is unsure which one to use.

Upon reaching the Capital, there are multiple modes of transportation available: taking the train, driving a car, or taking a plane. The previous responses did not specify which mode of transportation to use to get to the Seaside Town. This response addresses the question of which mode of transportation to use, specifying that driving a car is the best option because traveling by plane or train will take too long and the patient's condition could worsen. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple modes of transportation available in the Capital and is unsure which one to choose.

The Primeval Forest is a necessary path to return to the Capital, and it is known to be filled with dangers. The previous responses did not specify what kind of dangers to expect or how to protect oneself and the patient. This response addresses the question of what specific danger to prepare for, specifying that the forest is filled with poisonous insects and that insect resistance magic should be used to protect the patient and oneself. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the potential dangers in the Primeval Forest and is unsure how to protect against them.

But beware, the forest is full of dangers and you will need to use magic to protect the patient and yourself.

all_response:
Jax: First, use the carriage to transport the injured to Sun City, then take a faster mode of transportation to get the injured treated in Moon City. After passing through the Mystic Wasteland, you will see a forest; crossing the forest will lead you to Sun City. But be careful: the wasteland can make even the bravest lose their mind.
Jax: In the Mystic Wasteland, you need to take the fiery medicine and use the pain to keep yourself awake and tethered to reality. Only after leaving the wasteland, should you use an antidote to relieve your pain.
Jax: You need to pass through the Tropical Rainforest, which is an essential path to the city.
Jax: Upon arriving at Sun City, you should choose to travel by car to Moon City. Taking a plane or train is too risky because if the injured person has an emergency there will be no way to get treatment to them in time.

Jax previously mentioned the need to stay awake and tethered to reality in the Mystic Desert but did not explain how to achieve this. This response addresses the question of how to stay awake and maintain sanity in the desert, specifying that the fiery medicine should be used to induce pain and keep oneself awake, and that the antidote should be used afterward to relieve the pain. all_response:
Jax: You need to choose a suitable vehicle to escort the injured back to the castle. After passing through the Grand Canyon, you will see a forest, and by crossing the forest, you will be able to reach the Castle. During your time in the forest, you must continuously use defensive magic to protect the injured and yourself.
Jax: The forest paths are rugged so you should choose an off-road vehicle. 
Jax: The forest is filled with poisonous insects so you should be prepared to use the poisonous insect defense magic.
Jax: The Tropical Rainforest is the essential route to the castle.
